sentences.sContent: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.sCn: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.sContent: ...their memories are highly self-centred: although they can remember “autobiographical” life events in extraordinary detail...
...A couple of recent papers have finally opened a window on these people’s extraordinary minds...
...there is no such thing as a “perfect” memory—their extraordinary minds are still using the same flawed tools that the rest of us rely on...
...The authors of the Berkeley study theorize that the teachers leave because of the extraordinary demands: long hours...

synos.tran: 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；临时的；特派的

phrases.pCn: 特别会员大会；非常股东大会

remMethod.val: extra(以外的) ＋ ordinary(平常的) → 平常之外的 → 非同寻常的

trans.tranCn: 非同寻常的， 特别的
